 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 3.1 - READABLE
ABBREVIATIONS(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

A mechanism for identifying the expanded form or meaning of abbreviations is
available. 

These websites...

Make text content readable and understandable.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 A dictionary search form. 

A Web site includes a search form provided by an on-line acronym service. Users
enter an acronym and the form returns a list of possible expansions from the
sources that it searched. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/abbreviations.html#examples] Web
Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
